template.name: OS Solaris
template.description:
Base OS Solaris monitoring.
Version: 1.0.4 (2018-06-11) URL: https://github.com/kloczek/zabbix-templates/tree/master/OS%20Solaris
Notes:

item.name: SYS::process::running
item.description: Number of processes in running state.

item.name: SYS::process::*
item.description: Total number of processes in any state.

item.name: CPU::ints
item.description: CPU interrupts per second.

item.name: SYS::load:$2
item.description: Avg1 system running queue length.

item.name: CPU::context switches
item.description:
All CPUs context switches per second.
lowered from 10 -> 5 second updates as characteristics observed are very different

item.name: CPU::$2::$3
item.description: The time the CPU has spent doing nothing.

item.name: CPU::$2::$3
item.description: Amount of time the CPU has been waiting for I/O to complete.

item.name: CPU::$2::$3
item.description: The time the CPU has spent running the kernel and its processes.

item.name: CPU::$2::$3
item.description: The time the CPU has spent running users' processes that are not niced.

item.name: SYS::hostname
item.description: System host name.

item.name: zfs:*:arcstats:c_max
item.description:
ZFS ARC maximum size.
Configured in /etc/system
i.e. set zfs:zfs_arc_max=34359738368

item.name: zfs:*:arcstats:c_min
item.description: ZFS ARC minimum size.

item.name: zfs:*:arcstats:c
item.description: ZFS ARC target size.

item.name: zfs:*:arcstats:demand_data_hits
item.description:
ZFS ARC Demand hit count
Directed requests to the ARC, not predicted requests
streaming ratio = prefetch_* / (hits + misses)

item.name: zfs:*:arcstats:prefetch_data_hits
item.description:
ZFS ARC prefetch.
Prefetch is the ZFS read-ahead feature, to predict and pre-cache blocks for streaming (sequential) workloads. All the prefetch statistics refer to ARC requests that have originated from the ZFS prefetch algorithm – which happens before the ARC – and without knowing whether the data is already cached in the ARC. So, a prefetch hit means that ZFS initiated a prefetch, which was then found in the ARC. Thus the prefetch ARC access wasn't actually needed. This happens if cached data is repeatedly read in a sequential manner.

item.name: zfs:*:arcstats:prefetch_metadata_hits
item.description:
ZFS ARC metadata prefetch.
Prefetch is the ZFS read-ahead feature, to predict and pre-cache blocks for streaming (sequential) workloads. All the prefetch statistics refer to ARC requests that have originated from the ZFS prefetch algorithm – which happens before the ARC – and without knowing whether the data is already cached in the ARC. So, a prefetch hit means that ZFS initiated a prefetch, which was then found in the ARC

item.name: zfs:*:arcstats:demand_data_misses
item.description:
ZFS ARC Demand miss counts
Directed requests to the ARC, not predicted requests
streaming ratio = prefetch_* / (hits + misses)

item.name: zfs:*:arcstats:demand_metadata_hits
item.description:
ZFS ARC Demand metadata hit count
Directed requests to the ARC, not predicted requests
streaming ratio = prefetch_* / (hits + misses)

item.name: zfs:*:arcstats:demand_metadata_misses
item.description:
ZFS ARC Demand metadata miss counts
Directed requests to the ARC, not predicted requests
streaming ratio = prefetch_* / (hits + misses)

item.name: zfs:*:arcstats:hits
item.description:
ZFS ARC hits counter.
hits = demand_data_hits + demand_metadata_hits + prefetch_data_hits + prefetch_metadata_hits

item.name: zfs:*:arcstats:memory_throttle_count
item.description:
ZFS ARC throttle counter
number of times that ZFS had to limit the ARC growth.
A constant increasing of the memory_throttle_count statistic can indicate excessive pressure to evict data from the ARC.

item.name: zfs:*:arcstats:mfu_ghost_hits
item.description:
ZFS ARC MFU ghost hit counter
hits against pages held in ghost mfu list from pages evicted from ARC mfu list

item.name: zfs:*:arcstats:mfu_hits
item.description: MFU List hits per second.

item.name: zfs:*:arcstats:misses
item.description:
ZFS ARC misses counter.
misses = demand_data_misses + demand_metadata_misses + prefetch_data_misses + prefetch_metadata_misses

item.name: zfs:*:arcstats:mru_ghost_hits
item.description:
ZFS ARC MRU ghost hit counter
Hits against pages held in ghost mru list from pages evicted from ARC mru list

item.name: zfs:*:arcstats:mru_hits
item.description: MRU List hits per second.

item.name: zfs:*:arcstats:size
item.description: ZFS ARC size.

item.name: SYS::uname
item.description: The information as normally returned by 'uname -a'.

item.name: SYS::uptime
item.description: The OS uptime.

item.name: SYS::users sessions
item.description: Number of users tty sessions who are currently logged in.

item.name: MEM::$1
item.description: Available memory is defined as free+cached+buffers memory.

item.name: CHK::unsupported items
item.description: Counter with per host number of items in 'unsupported' state.

discovery_rule.name: DSK:
discovery_rule.description: List of Solaris storage devices (typically displayed by iostat -x).

item_prototype.name: {#DISK}::read::IOs::size
item_prototype.description: Size of read IO in bytes.

item_prototype.name: {#DISK}::read::bytes
item_prototype.description: Number of read bytes per second on block device in use.

item_prototype.name: {#DISK}::read::IOs
item_prototype.description: Number of read IO operation per second on block device in use.

item_prototype.name: {#DISK}::write::IOs::size
item_prototype.description: Size of write IO in bytes.

item_prototype.name: {#DISK}::write::bytes
item_prototype.description: Number of write bytes per second on block device in use.

item_prototype.name: {#DISK}::write::IOs
item_prototype.description: Number of write IO operation per second on block device in use.

discovery_rule.name: ZFS::L2ARC:
discovery_rule.description: Using unix:0:l2arc_buf_t:alloc kstat metrics detect does zfs pools are using L2ARC or not.

discovery_rule.name: ZPOOL:
discovery_rule.key: system.run["zpool list -Ho name|awk 'BEGIN {print \"{\\"data\\":[\"; ORS=\"\"} {if (NR>1) {print \",\n\"}; print \"{\\"{#ZPOOL}\\":\\"\" $1 \"\\"}\"} END {print \"]}\"}'"]

item_prototype.name: {#ZPOOL}::version
item_prototype.description: zpool version on pool, does not change often so check infrequently

trigger_prototype.name: ZPOOL::{#ZPOOL} is in {ITEM.VALUE} state
trigger_prototype.description:
Some vdevs in zpool {#ZPOOL} are not ONLINE and whole zpool is not in ONLINE state.
Please login on the host and check output of the commands: - "zpool status {#ZPOOL}" - "fmadm faulty"

trigger.name: SYS::Host is down
trigger.description: Instructions on how to handle this trigger if is active: * with daily autoscaling like PERF, PAT or DEV -> delete box * if it is PROD or STAGE box: ** remove all groups and assign box to "Terminated instances" group ** change Name to "term YYYY-MM-DD <orig_Name>" ** set host Monitored by proxy -> (no proxy) ** change state to "not monitored" * anything else -> investigate -> acknowledge and raise jira ticket if it is something unusual
